title: For Sale:  AR-15 Pistol
postcontent:
I have for sale a custom built AR-15 pistol chambered in 5.56 NATO which can also shoot .223 Remington. It has a 6.5" barrel, free floating handguard with knurled surface, and a Phantom flash suppressor. Unlike most AR-15 pistols, this one does not need a buffer assembly so it is more compact. The lower receiver is plugged where a stock could go in order to attach a single point sling that is quick detachable.

On a side note, if Iowa would ever allow citizens to own National Firearms Act regulated items, then one could add a side folding telescoping buttstock and register the gun with the ATF as an Any Other Weapon for only $5! 

Back to the features this gun currently has; the safety, magazine release, and bolt release are all ambidextrous. Also the charging handle can be moved to either side.  The trigger guard is over sized. The red dot has a 5 MOA reticle with 11 brightness settings. An enhanced extractor with spring and insert was installed, tuned, and the gun has been fired reliably with surplus M193. A hundred or so rounds were all that has been shot through the gun and it was a blast. The recoil isnât bad at all. The gun comes with a case, 30 round windowed PMAG, and some of the add-on items original packaging.  I also will include an OA-93 manual which is what the gun is based on. Here is a breakdown of some of the parts used in the build: 

Olympic Arms OA-93 Upper Receiver					
Superior Arms S-15 pistol marked lower receiver			
DPMS Panther Arms AR15 Lower Receiver Parts Kit			
DPMS Panther Arms Ambi Safety Selector Switch							
TRUGLO  40mm red dot (original packaging included)

Fulton Armory 1-piece McFarland bolt gas ring				 
Magpul PMAG 30 MagLevel Magazine			
Troy Industries Ambidextrous Magazine Release

postcontent:
Draco AK Pistol (Model C).  The C model has the rear trunnion that is already set for under-folder!  

I have shot 30-rds thorough gun for test fire.  Comes with  30rd mag. And a false cleaning rod (no threads) but adds A lot for aesthetics!  I also removed tack weld and barrel nut since these rifles are prone to have some gunk on the threads, I totally cleaned the threads just have not put a brake on since have not found one to decide on. Almost every family has great grandpa's old shotgun. It may have been in the family for generations! It is a keepsake but needs to be put into better shape. Parts may be missing. As an example, most of the guns we restore are over 100 years old! As of right now, firearms pre 1899 are considered antique and are EXEMPT from federal law & ATF rules.
We can offer Professional Results. Your family heirloom will look, "Good as great Grandpa bought it!"
We are not a dealer and do not sell guns. However, we can restore your family treasure to its original out-of-the box appearance. title: For Sale/Trade:  Russian Tula SKS 1952 ALL ORIGINAL, non-refurb
postcontent:
Russian SKS Tula 1952 ALL ORIGINAL, NOT a factory refurb. This is a collectors grade rifle. No re-arsenal markings or signs of refurbishment anywhere on this rifle. It has all matching numbers on the bolt, carrier, stock, receiver, receiver cover, magazine, trigger guard, rear sight, and gas tube. It has the original blade bayonet, original cleaning rod, original cleaning kit, 10 stripper clips, 200 rounds of Russian match grade 7.62x39 ammo, and case. The bore is bright and shiny with strong rifling. The bluing is original and none of the pats have been painted over later. The stock is its original dark hardwood finish and has the original serial number without being forced matched and having a bunch of XXXXX's over the old serial number. The stock has no cracks or deep gouges, just minor handling wear. The receiver cover is marked with the Tula star inside the star logo and has the date stamp of 1952r under the logo. I bought this gun over a year and a half ago and it has sat in the safe ever since. I have never fired it, and never planned to in order to keep it in the collectors condition it is currently in. I know what this gun is worth as would any serious SKS collector so please don't try to low ball me and compare this with the Yugo's and Norinco's out there. Take a look at gunbroker for similar condition rifles and you will see that there are few out there and are worth every bit of my asking price. 

Bottom dollar price is $550 FIRM.  I am located in Dublin and if you want to buy this, you must be willing to meet me in this area. My job doesn't typically allow me time to travel beyond the Dublin area. If interested, email me. Thanks for looking.

title: For Sale/Trade:  WWII Remington model 11
postcontent:
I have a remington model 11 US marked shotgun for sale. Barrel and reciever both have US and flaming bomb mark. Along with military finish stamped on reciever. This is one of the early ones with the rollmarked scenes on the sides of reciever. Has a serial number of 47*47* which is a neat number repeating. 
It has the 26 inch barrel. Barrel dates to MM for 1943. Has improved Cyl bore. Four in tube one in chamber. Action works great, fires great. Blueing is good and wood is good with no cracks in stock. 
The 26 inch barreled ones were used for trainning for air crews before using the 50 caliber machine guns. Very  nice shotgun used during WWII. 

I'm asking 600 or open to trades for pistols, 45acp 1911 of some sort, 32acp or 380 colt, old or new pistols is fine. Or older military pistols. Just get ahold of me and let me know what you have and may be interested.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Interarms/Zastava Mini Mauser w/scope and sling
postcontent:
I have a Interarms Mini MK X in .223 Remington, medium profile barrel, and walnut stock. It's a left hand stock, right hand bolt (I've no idea why, bought it that way years ago but I'm right handed and it's never been a problem), but beautiful tiger striped walnut with satin finish. I've babied this rifle for years, has clean sharp rifling, good wood, and is sub -MOA with even Russian ammo. It's taken my first deer, coyote, bobcat, and with Barnes ammo, it can take deer, hogs, coyotes etc. at decent range. It's been my go to rifle for hunting on foot, and doubles as a bet winner on the farm! It's no problem to hit consistently with this lil guy inside of 400 yds (never used it further). It's the first bolt gun I ever owned, and it would do well as a truck/varmint/predator/deer/hog gun for a small kid, or even a fun gun for an adult. I'm 5,10", 200 lbs, and it's a dream to lug into the deer woods!

title: For Sale:  Polish p64 9x18 pistol
location: south of manchester, Manchester, New Hampshire
postcontent: I'm selling my Polish P64 pistol. it's chambered in 9x18 makarov, NOT 9x19 luger - while not difficult to find, you can't get this ammo at walmart. It's got some light holster wear. I upgraded the mainspring and recoil spring with wolff replacements, stiffer for the recoil and lighter for the main. the original springs are included. it's got a bit of a kick to it. it includes two magazines, one matching the serial of the pistol, and one other. also included are a leather holster with a mag pouch attached and about 100 rounds of 9x18 fiocci hollow points. the pistol doesn't seem to feed these very well, i think it would benefit from a feed ramp polishing. i've had no problems with fiocci's FMJ ammo, you can pick some up at firing line in manchester and riley's in hooksett. i'm looking to pick up a .22 pistol, i'll consider trades for any ruger mark  (1,2,3) pistols in good condition (obviously i'll toss some cash in for more valuable guns) or an sr22 pistol. also kinda looking for an SKS or mosin, but i'm more interested in .22 pistols. thanks for looking! sorry about the pictures, my cell camera kinda sucks.

title: For Sale:  Preppers - healthy meal replacement foods
postcontent:
Hey All,

I'm a personal trainer, engineer, and prepper (yeah, strange combo).  I've been using Isagenix products myself, as well as have most of my clients use it, and the more I think about it, this is a FANTASTIC prepping item to add to your stash.

The basics of it are a meal replacement shake that you can have either with straight water, or mix with other things (I like a mix of blueberries, raspberries, peanut butter, and whole milk).  There's also soup mixes in tomato or chicken which I usually mix a bit of each.  And there's a ton of other great products.  As a distributor, I get much better prices than what's listed on the webpage, and would be happy to help the local prepping community without taking a cut.

Check out the products at http://ianjaeger.isagenix.com/us/en/home.dhtml# and if you want to try one, let me know.  I can eventually send an individual packet sampler pack (1 shake, 1 soup, 1 cookie) for a couple of bucks if you want to try before buying a box of 14.

Oh, this isn't just some diet shake mix.  While Isagenix is known for it's 9 and 30 day cleanses to help you drop weight, it's also used by elite athletes looking for a USOC / NCAA approved dietary edge.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Kar 98k rifle, Mosin nagant 1935 tula arsenal hex reciever
postcontent: I have a very nice Preduzece 44 mod.98 Karabiner 98k. It is a little diffrent in that the yugo crest was scrubbed off for some unkown reason. I have been told that it was possible that it was captured in the yugoslave wars and the crest was removed possibly around 1990. Either way its a fine example of a k98 and has a nice bore with strong rifling, with that said it has some frosting do to the corrosive ammo but the pics will show the strong rifling.  There are 2 waffen marks on the rifle wich are hard to see in the pictures but they are there. The rifle has been well oiled and always remains clean as the finish is worn as can see in the pic but no rust has developed. There is a nice petina on the bolt. The rifle has been fired with 5 rounds of federal ammo and has as 3.5 inch groupings at 450 yards with iron sites. Trifle comes with 570 rounds of 8mm ammo. The ammo is 16 boxes of 15 round star marked snipper ammo, 16 boxes of brown boxed 15 round yugo ammo, and 6 romanian boxes of 15 steel core rounds for a total of 570 rounds. Also included is a yugo bayonet, high quality reproduction 98k sing with the correct double hatching and stiching, original cleaning rod, 8 8mm tipton brushes,and 30 empty stripper clips. Also I have  a 1935 tula arsenal marked hex reciever mosin nagant (m91/30),these are getting harder to come by. The rifle has a nice barrel with alot of bright and strong rifling, there is 2 spots that are dark but overall its a great barrel. The stock is in original condition and has minor dings and scratches that would be common for something this age, however there are no cracks our splits. The blueing is in great condition and there are only small nicks on the metal in a few spots. The rifle comes with a sling, bayonet, oil canister, ammo pouch, and tools to service the the mosin nagant. This rifle is black powder marked and again is a hex reciever with a strong bore. This is a great deal and hate to offer both of them for trade but just purchased a nice arsenal milled bulgarian ak47 so dont wanna break the bank again with another purchase.
